abstract: Wyatt Cenac, former correspondent and writer for Comedy Central’s The Daily Show, says in Marc Maron podcast interview that he and show host Jon Stewart argued over 2011 parody of black businessman Herman Cain that Cenac felt was racially insensitive; Cenac, only black writer on show at time, said Stewart’s response to criticism left him feeling disrespected and alienated.
lead_paragraph: The writer, Wyatt Cenac, says that the argument stemmed from what he saw as a racially insensitive segment in 2011.

headline.main: ‘Daily Show’ Writer Recalls Heated Dispute With Jon Stewart
headline.print_headline: ‘Daily Show’ Race Dispute Is Recalled by Writer

snippet: The writer, Wyatt Cenac, says that the argument stemmed from what he saw as a racially insensitive segment in 2011.

keywords.value: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)
keywords.name: creative_works
